event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal error was detected within an IOC chip. The fatal error affects only one leaf within an IO Channel (1/2 an IO Channel).
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A fatal error was detected within an IOC chip. The fatal error only affects one leaf within
an IO Channel (1/2 an IO Channel).

The domain using the IO channel leaf is reset.

The IO Channel leaf (1/2 an IO Channel) will be deconfigured
after the domain using the IO Channel is reset.


Availability of I/O devices depends on which IO Channel leaf was deconfigured.


    SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provices access to the internal IO and PCI slot 0.

      Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 1, 2, and 3.



    SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:


       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCIe slot 1,
       and all the internal I/O.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 2.

       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 3.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 4.




    SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:


       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI-X slot 0, PCIe slot 1,
       and all the internal I/O.

          IOU#0: Internal I/O includes the DVD drive, the DAT drive, HDD#0 and HDD#1.
          IOU#1: Internal I/O includes HDD#2 and HDD#3.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 2.

       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 3.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 4.




    SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:


       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 0.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 1.

       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 2.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 0, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 3.

       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 1, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 4.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 1, IO Channel 0, provides access to PCI slot 5.

       Leaf 0 on IOC chip 1, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 6.

       Leaf 1 on IOC chip 1, IO Channel 1, provides access to PCI slot 7.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:06:46 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 60aa280e-3df4-4561-87b8-5b0d3f0d2df6
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-QX for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8001-QX, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:06:46 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 60aa280e-3df4-4561-87b8-5b0d3f0d2df6
   DESC: A fatal error was detected within an IOC chip. The fatal error affects only one leaf within
   an IO Channel (1/2 an IO Channel).
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8001-QX for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The IO Channel leaf (1/2 an IO Channel) will be deconfigured after the domain using the IO
   Channel is reset.
   IMPACT: The domain using the IO Channel leaf is reset. The IO Channel leaf (1/2 an IO Channel) will be
   deconfigured after the domain is reset.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 60aa280e-3df4-4561-87b8-5b0d3f0d2df6

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:06:46.8494 60aa280e-3df4-4561-87b8-5b0d3f0d2df6 SCF-8001-QX
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.ioc.ch.leaf.fe

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/iou=0/ioc=0/ch=0/leaf=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B55X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/IOU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.


If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The domain using the IO Channel leaf is reset. The IO Channel leaf (1/2 an IO Channel) will be deconfigured after the domain is reset.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The IO Channel leaf (1/2 an IO Channel) will be deconfigured after the domain using the IO Channel is reset.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal error detected within an IOC chip.
